data.title: Guide to Musical Theatre
data.text:
OSCAR STRAUS

Austrian Composer and conductor: born Vienna 6 March, 1870; died Bad Ischl, 11 January, 1954

Stage Works

Over 40 works (most published in vocal score in Vienna or Berlin) incl.

Die lustigen Nibelungen (The Merry Nibelungs) (Operetta, 3 acts; Rideamus [Fritz Oliven]), Carltheater, 12 November, 1904;

Colombine,(Ballet) Berlin, 1904

Zur indischen Witwe (Operetta, 3 acts; Libretto by Ignatz Schnitzer) Centraltheater, Berlin 1905

Hugdietrichs Brautfahrt (Hugdietrich's Honeymoon) (Operetta, 3 acts; Rideamus [Fritz Oliven]), Carltheater, 10 March 1906;

Ein Walzertraum (A Waltz Dream) (Operetta, 3 acts; Lyrics by Felix Dörmann; Libretto by Leopold Jacobson, after Hans Müller: Carltheater 2 March, 1907: Hicks Theatre, London 1908 (136 perfs)

Das Buch der Abenteuer), Carltheater, 2 March 1907;

Der tapfere Soldat (The Gallant Soldier) (Operetta, 3 acts; R. Bernauer, Leopold Jacobson, "an unauthorised parody of G.B. Shaw's, Arms and the Man), Theater an der Wien,

14 November, 1908;

Didi (Operetta, 3 acts; based on the play by Sardou)

Das Tal der Liebe (operetta, 3 acts) Volksoper, 1909

Mein junger Herr (My Son John) (Operetta, 3 acts) 1910

Der tapfere Cassian (The Brave Cassian) (Play - 1 act) Libretto by Arthur Schnitzler (1912)

Die Prinzessin von Tragant (Regel), (Ballet) Vienna, Hofoper, 13 November, 1912

The Dancing Viennese; Operetta, 1 act; London Coliseum 1912

Love and Laughter; New Theatre, London 1913 (65 perfs)

Rund um die Liebe (Operetta, 3 acts; R. Bodanzky, F. Thelen), Johann Strauss, 9 November, 1914

Die Perlen der Cleopatra (Operetta, 3 acts; Julius Brammer and Alfred GrÃ¼nwald, Theater an der Wein 17 November, 1923

Der letzte Walzer (Operetta, 3 acts; J. Brammer, A. Griinwald), Berlin, Berliner Theater, 12 Feb 1920; Mariette, ou comment on écrit l'histoire (Operetta, 3 acts; Guitry), Paris, Edouard VII, 1 Oct 1928;

Eine Frau, die Weiss was sie will (Operetta, 3 acts; Grunwald, after L. Verneuil), Berlin, Metropol, I Sept 1932;

Drei Walzer (Operetta, 3 acts; P. Knepler, A. Robinson), Zurich, Stadttheater, 1935;

Die Musik kommt (3; Knepler, Robinson), Zurich, Sladttheater, 1948; rev. as Ihr erster Walzer, Munich, Gartnerplatz, 1950;

Bozena (Operetta, 3 acts; Brammer, Griinwald), Munich, Gartnerplatz, 16 May 1952

OTHER WORKS

Film scores: Jenny Lind, 1930; The Smiling Lieutenant, 1932; The Southerner, 1932; One hour with You, 1932; Die Herren von Maxim, 1933; Frühlingsstimmen, 1934; Land Without Music, 1935; Make a Wish, 1935; La ronde, 1950; Madame de. .., 1952

c500 cabaret songs, chamber music, orch works, pf pieces, choruses

BIBLIOGRAPHY
